intro: Phormium forsterianum, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a striking plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sword-shaped leaves that can grow up to 2 meters in length. The plant produces large, showy inflorescences with purple or red flowers in the summer months. Its leaves are fibrous and have been historically used by Māori for weaving and crafting. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adaptable to various climate conditions.
